alert.note: Alert for St. Louis; St. Louis City (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 4:37AM CDT until July 26 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR CREVE COEUR, FRONTENAC, LADUE, UNIVERSITY CITY, AND MARYLAND HEIGHTS... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL SAINT LOUIS COUNTY AND THE SAINT LOUIS CITY... At 437 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported a water rescue of residence in Ladue and and multiple vehicles have been submerged. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Creve Coeur, Frontenac, Ladue, University City, and Maryland Heights. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Louis, St. Charles, Florissant, Chesterfield, University City, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves, Ferguson, Creve Coeur, Overland, Clayton, Cahokia, Jennings, St. Ann, Crestwood, Bridgeton, Bellefontaine Neighbors and Town and Country. This includes the following State Parks... Scott Joplin Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri near exit 231. This includes the following streams and drainages... Louisville Creek, Shady Grove Creek, Missouri River, Twomile Creek, Deer Creek, Glaize Creek, Martigney Creek, Mississippi River, Maline Creek, Cowmire Creek, Grand Glaize Creek, Creve Coeur Creek, Smith Creek, Bonhomme Creek, Caulks Creek and Gravois Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
